name: HHL Algorithm (2×2 Linear System)
description: Harrow-Hassidim-Lloyd algorithm: solve Ax=b for a 2×2 system A=diag(1,2), b=|0⟩ using 4 qubits.
long_description: The HHL algorithm solves sparse linear systems Ax=b exponentially faster than classical algorithms in certain regimes. It applies QPE to encode eigenvalues λ, performs a conditional rotation 1/λ on an ancilla, then uncomputes with inverse QPE. Post-selecting ancilla=|1⟩ yields |x⟩ ∝ A⁻¹|b⟩. For A=diag(1,2) with eigenvalues 1 and 2, b=|0⟩ is an eigenstate so x=A⁻¹b=|0⟩. This circuit is a pedagogical 4-qubit simplification.

references.title: Harrow, Hassidim, Lloyd (2009). Quantum Algorithm for Linear Systems of Equations. PRL 103, 150502

author: OpenQC Community
